title: Salahmu
author: Salahmu
content: I use to think about how difficult things would have been for us as a Nigerians if there was no Cryptocurrency, considering how difficult it is to get a well paid job, I wonder what would have become of us, but with the help of Cryptocurrency  things became  more easy with many ways of making money through crypto as such most people now prefer online than working for someone. But Most times I use to imagine the way this country is moving, thousands and millions of unemployed youth, to even make the matter worst government doesn't even care about the welfare of the citizens, they does what they feel is right undermining if citizens are okay by it or not, There are millions people graduating everyday but no job. Your life before you started crypto and now which one is better? Let's share our experience.

comments.author: Adbitco
comments.body: Quote from: Salahmu on July 01, 2023, 09:48:16 PMYour life before you started crypto and now which one is better? Let's share our experience. Usually we can't compares our past life to present with cryptocurrency because it offers a variety of opportunities and draw us more closer to wealth creations, cryptocurrency I believe it was a God sent to deliver us from the hardship of the devil leadership and as I know every youths who are one way connected to cryptocurrency or digital currency aren't to be much dependant of the white scholar (collar) job instead prefer doing task online to keep them afloat. This could be trading, advertisement or affiliates marketing or content creations (vbloging, and youtube video).

comments.author: Forever101
comments.body: I am of different opinion to what you have said, to every circumstance, there will definitely be away of survival. Before the knowledge of Cryptocurrency, the country has been experiencing some hardship and people have lived and scale through. Since Cryptocurrency is not a get rich quick scheme, it has not so much affected our living but gave us option to invest in a place where we can expect big return. Bitcoin halving happens every 4 years where history repeats itself which is always everyone's expectation to make a lot of profit. What do we say then, does the 4 years investment make everyone rich even when many do not have money to invest due to the country's economy situation. Well I know bitcoins has come to stay, but we can be rational in our thinking. What happens if bitcoins does not exist until the next century, people alive as we speak now we definitely sought for a means of survival. Those that can actually boast of bitcoins achievement are early adopters who enjoy the unlimited privilege of selling high, though there are still opportunity to new users.

comments.author: Asiska02
comments.body: Quote from: Salahmu on July 01, 2023, 09:48:16 PMI use to think about how difficult things would have been for us as a Nigerians if there was no Cryptocurrency, considering how difficult it is to get a well paid job, It is difficult indeed to get a well paid job in Nigeria but that does not limit the fact that many people were still doing well before the awareness of bitcoin came to Nigeria. It was a means of creating more wealth for some people while some people took the advantage of it to lead them out of unemployment. Whatever the case maybe, it has undoubtedly helped and improved the well being of many Nigerians that have taken part in it and also help to reduce poverty level to some certain degree. In my opinion, bitcoin have added more value and positive impact to the Nigerians than attributing it to any negativity it must have been used for.

comments.author: CryptoHeadlineNews
comments.body: Quote from: Adbitco on July 01, 2023, 10:36:34 PMcryptocurrency I believe it was a God sent to deliver us from the hardship of the devil leadership and as I know every youths who are one way connected to cryptocurrency or digital currency aren't to be much dependant of the white scholar (collar) job instead prefer doing task online to keep them afloat. This could be trading, advertisement or affiliates marketing or content creations (vlogging, and youtube video).Not only crypto oh, but the opportunities which the internet brings has helped a whole lot of people living in poverty to make a good decent amount of money even in the absence of white collar job in this 21st century, which was never the same in the previous centuries. However, with the help of these 4 basic skills now, you could see an average Nigerian youth of age 18 to 30yrs living a better life that was mostly experienced by retired civil servants of age 50 to 60yrs after several years of hard work and investing, but crypto came and for those who could understand how the volatile nature of the market work were able to create such wealth in a year or two, which is the beauty ever experienced with the innovation of the internet.

comments.body: This topic and the content e dey funny but there is element of truth. Before and aftermath of Bitcoin can not be the same. Before I know Bitcoin live was sad, though I was not that poor guy but I was not satisfying my needs but after when invested in Bitcoin late 2021 till now, my life have changed though it is not much but to some extent. For those who have known crypto and key into im, their lives are not remain the same again. Bitcoin has changed a lot of lives in we country. Even at that there are some people who still dey sceptical about the technology. So orientation is still needed in Cryptocurrency in the country.

That's the exact case crypto is facing in Nigeria. Majority of our youths who claim to be crypto traders are nothing but into internet fraud while hide and disguise under crypto. Crypto has really helped a reasonable number of people out of poverty in this 21st century and as well as sent some to early grave due to carelessness in protecting their wallet.Mind you, crypto should not be compared with white collar job. Being in crypto make you the boss of your own wealth and decides by yourself while you face the risk involved alone but civil servants are entitled to pension and gratuities after retirement despite the fact that their appointment can be terminated anytime their employer wishes.For OP, just like everyone is saying, with or without crypto people will survive the hurdles. It's just a privilege and we should grab it while it lasts.

comments.author: ololajulo
comments.body: Not everyone in the country is involved in cryptocurrency, and there are challenges associated with it, particularly regarding patience and long-term investment. It is disheartening to witness limited diversification of assets and businesses in Nigeria. The massive returns seen in cryptocurrency are not exclusive to Nigeria, as other countries have also experienced them. The key difference lies in the regulation and taxation policies. Personally, my main challenge is finding ways to securely store my cryptocurrency returns in my Dorm account, potentially through peer-to-peer (P2P) exchanges.

comments.body: No doubt about your point OP as it is audibly loud and visibly clear to everyone who has been a part of this platform long before now and those who just joined not quite too long that bitcoin has done more than what some government and politicians have done in our country. This platform has made many  from nothing to something and still counting. Waiting for government and white collar Job was not feasible but making out time todo  much research  and learn counts to more discovery.In all, the Crypto currency awareness has done much in Nigeria and still needs more awareness campaign as there are still million and one person's ready to adopt it but have possibly not gotten the information about it properly.
